metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10317 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The fill_threshhold_buffer function in base/gxht_thresh.c in Artifex Software, Inc. Ghostscript 9.20 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted PostScript document.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10317` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ghostscript - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.8
ghostscript-x - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.8
libgs9 - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.8
libgs9-common - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ghostscript package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.8').
